title: Magic: The Gathering Spider-Man Gift Bundle & Booster Box Are Steeply Discounted
description: Marvel's Spider-Man Gift Bundle $64 (was $90) See at Amazon Marvel's Spider-Man Play Booster Box (30 Packs) $112 (was $209.70) See at Amazon Spidey's Spectacular Showdown Scene Box $28 (was $42) See at Amazon Several products in Magic: The Gathering's Spider-Man crossover set are up for grabs for massively reduced prices at Amazon. The Marvel's Spider-Man Bundle, which has been hard to find at Amazon for more than a month, was restocked December 19 for $48.49 (was $70)--and promptly sold out again. Thankfully, Target still has units available for the same price. The bundle comes with nine Play Booster Packs, an Alternate-Art Foil Promo Card, 30 Basic Land Cards, a Spider-Man-themed storage box, and a few other items. But before you buy the standard bundle, check out the Marvel's Spider-Man Gift Bundle for $64 (was $90). The Gift Bundle comes with everything featured in the standard bundle as well as one Collector Booster Pack, which are going for just under $40 on their own. Both Marvel's Spider-Man booster boxes are on sale for roughly $100 off. The Play Booster Box has dropped all the way down to $112, which means each of the 30 Booster Packs will cost you an average of $3.73. Each Play Booster includes 14 cards, so you're getting 420 cards total. The Collector Booster Box, meanwhile, is discounted to $357 (was $455.88). Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Nex Playground Boss Says The Console Solves The Wii "Problem"
description: While Sony and Nintendo have expanded their lead over Xbox, a dark horse console had a very strong showing in third place in November. The Nex Playground has emerged as a breakout hit, and CEO David Lee believes that one of the reasons why its been so successful is because the console has solved the Wii "problem." Nearly two decades ago, the Wii powered Nintendo's post-GameCube comeback with its motion controls and unique games. Lee argues that the scope of Wii's success made it difficult to sustain in the long term. Instead of trying to sell games like Wii, Nex Playground is offering its titles as part of a subscription service. "One of the most important things we should do is learn from history and try not to commit the same limitations, and that's why we have a subscription model," Lee told The Game Business. "Nintendo expanded the audience with Wii. When you expand the audience, and they want different things, and they only buy Wii Fit, Wii Sports and not many others ‚Ä¶ that's a bit of a problem." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Save Up To 25% On The Akira Manga Hardcover Edition
description: Akira Hardcover Collection Save Up To 25% See all volumes at Amazon Any list gathering up the best that anime has to offer will inevitably include Akira, and for good reason. The 1988 movie raised the bar for film animation and is widely credited with introducing mainstream audiences outside Japan to the medium. However, the anime adaptation is only part of the tale. Like innumerable other anime projects, Akira is adapted from a much longer--though lesser-known--manga series. While the Akira manga has been available in print for decades, a new Akira Hardcover Edition kicked off earlier in 2025, offering the most authentic presentation of Katsuhiro Otomo's groundbreaking sci-fi saga. If you've ever wanted to experience the full Akira saga, this is one of the best ways to do so--and as luck would have it, you can save a few dollars on these premium hardcover releases. Four volumes in the six-volume series are available to purchase at Amazon, and while these normally cost between $30 and $40, you can get them for up 25% off. Volumes 5 and 6 are also launching in the coming weeks, and preorders are live. Akira Hardcover Collection Save Up To 25% The Akira Hardcover books published by Kodansha use the updated translation and lettering of the 35th Anniversary Edition box set, and each book is presented as a large-sized 7" x 10" collectible. Like traditional manga, they are read from right to left, and the original Japanese-language hand-drawn sound effects from the manga have been restored. Each hardcover book has cover artwork based on the original manga tankabon volume artwork. As mentioned above, four volumes have launched so far, and are currently discounted to roughly $26 - $27 at Amazon (normally $30 - $35 each). The next release, Akira Hardcover Collection 5, releases on December 23. Preorders are discounted to $34 (down from $36). This will be followed by Akira Hardcover Collection 6, a month later on January 27, 2026. Preorders for volume six are available for $40. Check out all the Akira Hardcover Collection releases below. Akira Hardcover Collection 1 -- $26.61 ($35) Akira Hardcover Collection 2 -- $26.61 ($35) Akira Hardcover Collection 3 -- $25.70 ($30) Akira Hardcover Collection 4 -- $27.61 ($35) Akira Hardcover Collection 5 -- $34 ($36) | Releases December 23 Akira Hardcover Collection 6 -- $40 | Releases January 27, 2026 See all volumes at Amazon While the hardcover editions above are fresh reprints, you can also pick up all six of them as part of the Akira 35th Anniversary Manga Box Set. All six volumes come bundled together with the hardcover Akira Club art book and an exclusive pill patch. It's currently sold out, but it gets restocked periodically at Amazon, so it's worth checking back to see if it's available. Set in a dark future timeline, Akira first began publication in 1982 and ran for 120 chapters. Taking place in the post-apocalyptic city of Neo-Tokyo, the series examines the after-effects of a mysterious explosion that almost destroyed the city. Thirty years later, teenage biker gang leader Shotaro Kaneda finds himself in the middle of a plot that involves militant revolutionaries, psychically gifted individuals, military forces, and his childhood friend, Tetsuo Shima, who has begun to develop dangerously destructive psychic powers of his own. Akira manga was critically acclaimed for its mature themes, well-developed characters, intriguing storylines, and Otomo's artwork. In the years since its publication, it's become regarded as one of the pioneering works in the then-burgeoning Cyberpunk sci-fi subgenre. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Become A Pokemon Professor With The Upcoming Pokecology Guidebook
description: Pokecology: An Illustrated Guide to Pokemon Ecology $15 | Releases April 21, 2026 Preorder at Amazon Have you ever dreamed of being a Pokemon researcher? If so, you'll need to do some studying to become a bonafide expert in the field of pocket monsters, and that's where this informative book comes into play. Pokecology: An Illustrated Guide to Pokemon Ecology is an official book that explores the habitats of the famous monsters, and you can add it to your list of study materials for just $15 ahead of its release on April 21, 2026. Pokecology: An Illustrated Guide to Pokemon Ecology $15 | Releases April 21, 2026 The Pokecology explores the ecologies of Pokemon based on data from the Pokedex. The 208-page book is full of visuals that examine the similarities, differences, generalities, and relationships between Pokemon ecologies, and Chihiro Kinoshita, a real-life expert in animal behavior and ecosystems, has illustrated it. The book is also officially licensed by The Pokemon Company, as it's produced through its publishing imprint, Pikachu Press. Preorder at Amazon Gallery For more Pokemon academia, you can also check out Pokemon: The Complete Pocket Guide Volume 1 and Volume 2. The first 560-page volume covers Pokedex entries No. 1 through 442, and the 552-page Volume 2 covers Pok√©mon 443 through 898 on the National Pokedex. This is a fairly comprehensive list, but you won't find Pokemon from the Paldean region of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet listed here. The nice thing about these books is that they're designed to be pocket-friendly and they're also available as part of a two-book box set. Each Pokemon is accompanied by details on its stats, abilities, moves, and evolutions. Pokemon Pocket Guides Volumes 1 and 2 Pokemon Pocket Guide: Volume 1 -- $9.76 ($15) Pokemon Pocket Guide: Volume 2 -- $12.60 ($15) Pokemon Complete Pocket Guide Box Set (Vol. 1 and 2) -- $20.29 ($29) Speaking of Pokemon habitats and ecology, you can also look forward to Pokemon Pokopia next year. Preorders are now live for the Minecraft-inspired Pokemon game, which sees players work to restore a desolate land into a paradise for Pokemon. Priced at $70, it'll be released for Switch 2 consoles on March 5, 2026. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: This Magnetic Puzzle Is A Perfect Last-Minute Stocking Stuffer
description: TOSY Magnet Pyramid Stone $22.76 (was $30) See at Amazon It's down to the wire, and if you're looking to do some last-minute holiday shopping, we've got a great option for you. For a limited time, TOSY's wildly popular Magnet Pyramid Stone is on sale for just $22.76 (was $30) on Amazon, and is a perfect stocking stuffer to pick up if you're cutting it close with your gift-getting this year. You can create a seemingly endless number of shapes with it (the brand claims "one billion" of them), making it an effective and creative fidget toy for both kids and adults. But if you plan to pick one up, do it soon--these are popular on Amazon even at full price, and we expect this limited-time discount will only make them more in-demand. TOSY Magnet Pyramid Stone $22.76 (was $30) The TOSY Magnet Pyramid Stone is a unique STEM and fidget toy that allows you to let your creativity run wild. With it, you can create a vast number of shapes, all while stimulating your brain and calming your anxieties. The Pyramid Stone even comes with a spinning base so you can show off your favorite creations. The toy is extremely popular on Amazon, and it's currently sitting at a limited-time discount of just $22.76 (down from $30). It's the perfect size (and price) for a stocking stuffer gift, so get one on sale while you still can. See at Amazon TOSY also makes a bunch of other great stocking-stuffer-type gifts, from fidget spinners to magnetic puzzle cubes. If the pyramid isn't doing it for you (or you just want more than one gift), maybe one of these other options will. Don't worry, they're also on sale--but only for a limited time: TOSY Magnet Fidget Spinner Glow -- $19 ($24) TOSY Magnet Cube (2x2) -- $8.49 ($10) TOSY Magnet Cube (3x3) -- $29 ($37) TOSY Magnet Cube (4x4) -- $58 ($73) And if you're looking for even more ideas, you should check out Shashibo, another popular brand on Amazon that sells puzzles and fidget toys. The brand's Shape Shifting Box is on a limited-time sale for just $18.19 (was $28), and comes in a bunch of fun themes like SpongeBob, Hello Kitty, Avatar, and more. We have even more in-depth coverage of those Shashibo puzzle boxes here. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Stray Kids Are Coming To Roblox
description: The South Korean band Stray Kids is coming to Roblox today, and they'll be unleashing the SKZOO from now and through the weekend while promoting their new album, Do It. As seen in the clips below, Stray Kids' anthropomorphic avatars will be performing their songs in-game as virtual concerts. @robloxkr Ïä§ÌÖåÏù¥ ÏÜåÎ¶¨ ÏßàÎü¨! üó£Ô∏è SKZOOÍ∞Ä The BlockÏùÑ Ï∞¢ÏúºÎü¨ Ïò¥ üî• 12Ïõî 19Ïùº~21Ïùº Îî± 3ÏùºÎßå ÏßÑÌñâÎêòÎäî SKZOOÏáº & UGCÎìúÎ°≠! Ïù¥Í±∞ Ïïà Î≥¥Î©¥ ÏßÑÏßú ÏÜêÌï¥ÏûÑ.. ü•∫ Ïö∞Î¶¨ Ïä§ÌÖåÏù¥Îì§ÏùÄ Ïñ¥Îñ§ Ïä§ÌÇ§Ï£º ÏùëÏõêÌïòÎü¨ Í∞à Í±∞Ïïº? ÎåìÍ∏ÄÎ°ú ÏïåÎ†§Ï§ò! (ÎÇ¥ ÌîΩÏùÄ.. ü§´) #Î°úÎ∏îÎ°ùÏä§ #Roblox #Theblock #Ïä§Ìä∏Î†àÏù¥ÌÇ§Ï¶à #Straykids ‚ô¨ Ïò§Î¶¨ÏßÄÎÑê ÏÇ¨Ïö¥Îìú - Roblox Korea Stray Kids-related items are also hidden in four different Roblox experiences, with two items per game. Players can collect all eight items and bring them to the Block to watch Stray Kids perform and receive additional free items from the band. However, this event will only run until 10 AM PT/1 PM ET on Monday, December 22. In other Roblox-related news, the platform has been banned in Russia and accused of negatively impacting children, and apparently considers the dissemination of LGBTQIA+ content to be a crime. But Russia isn't alone with its accusations that Roblox hasn't done enough to protect kids from child exploitation and grooming. A June 2024 Bloomberg investigation reported that the platform is rampant with predators. More recently, Florida and Texas have sued Roblox over that issue. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Amazon Just Dropped An Exclusive '80s Film 4K Blu-Ray Bundle
description: Totally Awesome 80s Box Set (4K) $55 See at Amazon It's the most festive time of the year, and if you're looking to do some last-minute gift-shopping, what's better than a bundle of classic '80s action movies? Available exclusively on Amazon, cinephiles--or shoppers looking to get something for their dad--can grab the Totally Awesome 80s 4K Blu-ray bundle. The collection, which launched just a few days ago on December 16, includes 4K Blu-ray editions of five acclaimed 1980s films, plus bonus materials and digital streaming copies of each movie. The Totally Awesome 80s bundle in stock and available for $55 at Amazon. Totally Awesome 80s Box Set (4K) $55 The Totally Awesome 80s Box Set compiles 4K Blu-ray editions of five classic movies released by Paramount Pictures throughout the 1980s: Beverly Hills Cop Ferris Bueller's Day Off Top Gun Trading Places The Untouchables That's a nice selection of some of the decade's most notable action, comedy, and drama flicks. The 4K Blu-ray releases for each film support Dolby Vision, HDR10, and Dolby Atmos audio, and offer their own selection of bonus materials, including new behind-the-scenes documentaries, deleted scenes, music videos, audio commentary tracks, and more. See at Amazon If you've never seen these films, then you've missed out on some of the most influential movies of all time. Top Gun was a blockbuster hit that cemented Tom Cruise's stardom, combining incredible aerial photography and action set against some of the era's chart-topping pop and rock songs. Ferris Bueller's Day Off, one of John Hughes' best films, follows Bueller (Mathew Broderick), his girlfriend Sloane (Mia Sara), and his best bud Cameron (Alan Ruck) as they take an unscheduled break from school. The Untouchables is a ruthless turn-of-the-century gangster movie with an all-star cast, while Trading Places saw John Landis put his own spin on Wall Street, and Beverly Hills Cop is a breakout action-comedy hit that made Eddie Murphy a household name. Lots more vintage movie Blu-rays are currently on sale, if you're hunting for easy stocking-stuffers. James Bond fans can pick up various bundles dedicated to different 007 eras, or for a license to thrill, there's The James Bond Collection of 24-film Blu-rays for only $55 (was $120). Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Pokemon TCG Mega Charizard Ultra-Premium Collection Drops To $140 At Amazon
description: Pokemon TCG: Mega Charizard X ex Ultra-Premium Collection $140 (was $250) See at Amazon Mega Venusaur ex Premium Collection $74.89 See at Amazon Amazon has dropped the price of the Pokemon Trading Card Game's latest Ultra-Premium Collection. After initially restocking the Mega Charizard X ex Ultra-Premium Collection with a $165 asking price, Amazon is now selling the large collection of boosters and promo cards for $140. The Mega Charizard X ex Ultra-Premium Collection had sold for as high as $250 before launch and was $211 on launch day (November 14). It launched alongside Pokemon TCG's latest expansion set, Mega Evolution - Phantasmal Flames. Pokemon TCG collectors can also pick up the newly released Mega Venusaur ex Premium Collection for $74.89 at Amazon. Released earlier this month, the latest Mega Pokemon Premium Collection has been difficult to find in stock, so we wouldn't be surprised if it sold out again soon. Speaking of Premium Collections, the Lugia ex & Latias ex Premium Collection is back in stock for $100. Amazon also has a brand-new Pokemon TCG listing that has yet to be noticed by resellers. The Holiday 2025 Poke Ball Tins are available to order for $30 each. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Amazon Lightning Deal: Donkey Kong Bananza Amiibo Gets Big Price Cut
description: Donkey Kong and Pauline Amiibo $20 (was $30) Get deal at Amazon Donkey Kong fans can grab the Donkey Kong Bananza Amiibo for $20 (was $30) at Amazon right now. This is a Lightning Deal with limited quantities. At the time of writing, over 20% of the available Donkey Kong and Pauline Amiibo figures have been claimed. Amazon also has deals on two Amiibo figures that launched alongside the Nintendo Switch 2: Yunobo from The Legend of Zelda and Jamie from Street Fighter 6 are available for $8 each. Meanwhile, GameStop has all seven Switch 2 Amiibo launch figures for $6 each. The Legend of Zelda: Yunobo Amiibo -- $8 ($30) Street Fighter 6: Jamie Amiibo -- $8 ($40) Donkey Kong Bananza: Donkey Kong and Pauline -- $20 ($30) Donkey Kong and Pauline Amiibo $20 (was $30) Based on DK's wide smile, we imagine he's punching his way to a Banandium Gem. He's also moving fast because Pauline's legs are dangling in the air. The uneven ground beneath DK's feet aligns with rocky terrain found in Ingot Isle, Lagoon Layer, and other locales from the game. As for its functionality in the game, scanning the Donkey Kong and Pauline Amiibo grants two main perks. You can unlock Pauline's Diva Dress a lot earlier in your adventure with the Amiibo. The Diva Dress doubles the likelihood of enemies dropping music discs. To unlock the Diva Dress, you need to talk to the NPC shaped like the Amiibo in the Resort Layer. The NPC will ask you to show them the Amiibo to claim your reward. Without the Amiibo, this particular outfit is locked behind post-game challenges. Scanning the Bananza Amiibo also spawns gold KONG letters that can be smashed to refill Bananergy. KONG tiles can also be spawned by scanning older Donkey Kong Amiibo figures. Get deal at Amazon Nintendo Switch 2 Amiibo Deals at GameStop As mentioned, GameStop is selling all four The Legend of Zelda Switch 2 Amiibo, the three Street Fighter 6 Amiibo, and the Street Fighter 6 Amiibo Card Starter Set for only $6 each as part of its last-minute holiday sale. The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Amiibo Tulin -- $6 ($30) Sidon -- $6 ($30) Yunobo -- $6 ($30) Riju -- $6 ($30) Street Fighter 6 Amiibo Jamie -- $6 ($40) Luke -- $6 ($40) Kimberly -- $6 ($40) Street Fighter 6 Amiibo Card Starter Set -- $6 ($40) All Donkey Kong Amiibo Figures King K. Rool Amiibo (Donkey Kong) $18 (was $20) Preorder at Best Buy Most Amiibo figures featuring Donkey Kong characters are out of print, but King K. Rool received a Best Buy-exclusive reprint in September. Normally $20, Best Buy is selling the figure for $18. King K. Rool is the priciest preowned Amiibo in the series sold at GameStop, so fans who are interested in adding King K. Rool to their collection should snag one from Best Buy sooner rather than later. GameStop has two older Donkey Kong Amiibo for $18 each and two Diddy Kong Amiibo for $20 each. Amazon also has the Smash Bros. Series Donkey Kong Amiibo for $20, which would be its MSRP if reprinted today. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: SEC confirms years-long director bans for former Alameda, FTX executives
description: In the latest update on the FTX saga, the SEC confirmed Caroline Ellison had consented to a officer-and-director bar, preventing her from leading any companies for 10 years.

title: Crypto's closest ally in Congress, Sen. Lummis, is retiring next year
description: The most tireless advocate of digital assets issues in the U.S. Senate said she's grown too tired to keep at it, leaving her Republican seat in play next year.

title: Pro-crypto US Senator Lummis won‚Äôt seek reelection in 2026
description: Cynthia Lummis is one of the key Republicans responsible for pushing members of Congress to pass a crypto market structure bill under consideration in the Senate.

title: Australia was seen as a world leader in gun control - Bondi has exposed a more complicated reality
description: It introduced stricter gun laws after the 1996 Port Arthur massacre, but some say they now need to be tightened further.

title: Trump suspends U.S. green card lottery after Brown University shooting
description: USCIS is pausing the Diversity Immigrant Visa Program after the fatal Brown University shooting last week, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said.

title: SBF's cohorts at FTX take last SEC hit, Ellison banned from company roles for decade
description: Three of Sam Bankman-Fried's top lieutenants atop the former FTX empire ‚Äî Caroline Ellison, Gary Wang and Nishad Singh ‚Äî agreed to consent judgments.

title: Bitcoin gets 'base case' price target of $143,000 at Citigroup
description: The Wall Street bank said its bitcoin forecast relies on further crypto ETF inflows and a continued rally in traditional equity markets.

title: Bitcoin battles $89,000 price ceiling as bulls try to break U.S. sell pattern
description: Bitcoin bulls are putting up a fight on Friday to break this week's choppy action that has capped all advances at around $90,000.

title: Foundation behind restaking protocol EigenLayer plans bigger rewards for active users
description: An Incentives Committee would direct programmatic token emissions, focusing allocations on participants that secure AVSs and contribute to the EigenCloud ecosystem.

title: Polkadot's DOT holds steady with token unchanged over 24 hours
description: DOT has support in the $1.72-$1.74 zone.

title: Federal Reserve moves toward narrower, crypto-driven take on master accounts
description: The U.S. central bank has been mulling the idea of a "skinny" version of master accounts for firms that want payments access without the deeper Fed demands.

title: Citi is still a believer in crypto stocks despite bitcoin being rocked to end the year
description: Circle remains the bank's top pick in the sector, with Bullish and Coinbase following.

title: Trump's 'Gold Card' relies on legal loophole to help wealthy foreigners get U.S. visa
description: In exchange for $1 million and a $15,000 processing fee, "Gold Card" applicants will get full-time residency in the U.S., the program's website says.

title: CNBC's Official College Sports Valuations 2025: Top 75 athletic programs
description: The programs are worth a combined $51.22 billion, 13% more than the top 75 in last year's rankings.
